title: What are h1b visa timelines? - Quora
tags: Visas to the United States of America

response.answer_text: Disclaimer: I am not a lawyer Very general timelines: Year 0, before April 1st: Candidate applies for a job, interviews and gets an offer from the company, willing to sponsor the visa. April 1st, Year 0: Company applies for the H1B visa. April-September (Some years): H1B applications exceed quota, H1B lottery is conducted to select which applications are processed. (If application is selected for processing or quota is not exceeded on Year 0). H1B application is processed, yielding an accepted or rejected result. Requests to the sponsoring company for additional information can happen during this process. Year 0, usually before October. If application is accepted, approval notice is sent. Company sends all documentation required to the prospective employee. Employee gets an appointment in the preferred US embassy to get H1B stamped in their passport. Year 0, usually October 1st: Employee travels to the USA, enters with H1B visa, and starts the job at the Company Year 0–3. Employee stays working for the company. Optionally, they move companies, requiring a new H1B visa application but without date limitations, as they are cap-exempt assuming the first H1B visa was subject to the cap. Year 3 - Company applies for H1B visa renewal, for another 3 years. Year 4–6. Employee continues working for H1B sponsor. Still opportunities for transfer. Year 6 - Employee either leaves the USA or by now, has progressed enough in the Green Card process timeline (not included in this description), to either have additional extension time or move to work on EAD or GC.

For H1B there is a fixed time slot for each of the activity - from applying till stamping of the visa. Applications have to filled and submitted by March. Lottery for selecting the cap of H1B visa is done by USCIS in the month of April. By May, USCIS starts informing the people who have been selected in the lottery and also starts processing of visa for the people who have chosen premium processing option, which comes at a price.Once premium processing is done, the processing starts for all the other people who were selected in the lottery. By June - July USCIS starts informing people if their visa has been approved or if they require any more information or documents for the same. Once approved, you can go to the consulate you would have chosen while applying for the visa, to get the visa stamped on your passport. Post October, you are allowed to travel to U.S. if you could get your visa stamped successfully.
